details: Kalinga Sikhya Sathi Yojana is an educational loan scheme for students who want to pursue their higher studies. The objective of the scheme is to bring down the financial burden on the parents of the students who want to move forward with higher education.
benefits: Minimum Loan: No minimum loan amount mentioned
Period of Loan: Up to 10 years and 15 years in respect of loans sanctioned up to ₹ 7,50,000 and ₹ 10,00,000 respectively
Rate of Interest: 1% interest on the loan amount, with the balance amount borne by the Government of Odisha, Higher Education Department
eligibility: The student must be a resident/domicile of Odisha
The annual income of the applicant's family should be less than or equal to ₹ 8,00,000 per annum
Poor students willing to continue higher studies can apply for a loan under this scheme
The student shouldn’t avail of similar benefits from any other Government/Institution for the same purpose
The student must have secured admission to a higher education course in recognized institutions in India or Abroad

The course of study be in Management or Integrated Law or Course of Engineering or Medicine in any Educational Institution in India established by Acts of Parliament or by Any State Legislature or other institutions recognized by the concerned Statutory Bodies
exclusions: The interest subsidy under this scheme shall not be available to those students who discontinue their course midstream, or who are expelled from the Institution on disciplinary or academic grounds or gives up Indian Citizenship during the tenure of the period
application_process: Online: Visit the Official Website of Vidya Lakshmi, register and apply for the scheme
Offline: Download the application form, fill it up and submit it to the concerned authorities
documents_required: 2 passport size photograph of the applicant
Proof of Identity: Valid identification documents issued by the government
Proof of Residence: Documents that establish the candidate’s residency in Odisha
Income Certificate: Certificates indicating the annual family income, issued by a competent authority
Educational Documents: Marksheets of previous qualifying examinations
Admission Letter: Admission letter/proof of enrollment/studentship/identity card, etc. from the educational institution
Fee Structure: A document detailing the course fees, including tuition fees, hostel charges, and other academic-related expenses
Bank Account Details: Information regarding the student’s bank account including the account number and IFSC code for loan disbursement purposes
